posts.name: Anonymous
posts.sub: Pirated software is full of malware and you're coping
posts.com:
Why do people say that "pirated games don't have viruses bro", it seems to be a common myth. For example, entire "online-fix" is basically just malware distribution with a crypto miner. Every single time I went through their .dlls at least one had an obvious detection.

Hell, I came across an infected .dll even in a fitgirl release. Fitgirl just repacks, yet still will pull infected crap sometimes, and that's the uploader with least cases so far. However I noticed almost EVERY uploader has malware in their shit. I only downloaded from ""trusted"" downloaders on 1337x (such as fitgirl or DODI). I even got banned once on 1337 for mentioning detections on one of their files. What a coincidence eh?

And that's only the ones that virustotal can detect. Can you imagine the amount of novel malware that goes undetected in newer releases? AV programs aren't perfect and it usually takes months before they reliably detect a new threat.

tl;dr pirated games are a haven for cryptominers and mass stealing of data/joining your PC into a botnet.

Ever since I started scanning every single file in pirated games I downloaded I stopped trusting any and all "torrenting" sites. I guess it's true, if you don't pay, you're the product. Also protip: never trust big .exe files. They are overbloated so you can't scan them and guaranteed to be malware.
